body:
Shouldn't you use `\usetheme` instead of `\color`?
As I understood you made a LaTex file `.tex`, not a theme file `.dtx`


What the _theme_ call in LaTex file:
```tex
\usepackage{dracula/latex/draculaheader}
\usetheme{dracula}
```

Good idea! ~Right now this is very simple, just a few lines which can be pasted into a preamble. I agree that it would be nice to have this as a proper package which you can import with `\usepackage` so I'll work on that.~ it is done :sunglasses: 

The difference between `\color` and `\usetheme` is that `\color` sets a specific color (for the text after it), whereas `\usetheme` sets an overall theme for the entire document. I prefer to have manual control of color for specific text, so the default right now is just standard dracula background and foreground for all text. Maybe we could have some nice defaults with `\usetheme`, do you have any ideas?
@avelino the theme now uses proper latex packaging :tada:

Woooow, LaTeX! This is big üòÆ 

Keep them coming @tim-clifford üßõ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è 

P.S. This generator looks pretty cool too, I'll check it out later

And we're live! https://draculatheme.com/latex üéâ üéâ üéâ 

I can't wait to see what people are going to build with this.

# But Hoow?^^

I dont get this Header thing, need some help^^

## Problem

I have a scrabled markdown file and want to convert it into pdf via pandoc.
Looks solid but the titlepage is not that cool.

##  Context

[Picture - MD vs PDF](https://i.ibb.co/Z1KB9QS/image.png)
[Picture - Pandoc Command vs PDF](https://i.ibb.co/fGGbGwG/image.png)
[PDF File](https://file.io/ggtSEM318rak)
[MD File](https://file.io/pweb64TGc0jB)
```sh
pandoc -s --defaults /home/frank/.config/pandoc/dracula.yaml example.md -o example.pdf
```
```md
% Whitepaper 
% Frank
% 11.05.2022
\newpage

\begin{abstract}

Lorem porro sed error aut quaerat? Adipisci unde quia quibusdam nesciunt cumque quis expedita possimus distinctio Facilis quam facere aspernatur architecto quia Soluta ipsam facilis tenetur totam deserunt illum omnis! Ratione maiores sit quia modi laudantium! Eum omnis quibusdam tempore ab soluta odit Asperiores expedita facilis molestias repellendus rem quia?

Elit aspernatur neque fugit a consequatur. Blanditiis nam vitae debitis eveniet fugit quas Modi rem debitis quaerat laboriosam natus? Minus cupiditate suscipit ut sunt optio In dolore cum repellendus quas corporis, veniam Officia autem ex deserunt optio officiis. Blanditiis quia odio praesentium modi expedita! Hic quas iure voluptate aliquid magnam

\end{abstract}

\newpage

\tableofcontents

\newpage

Sed blanditiis doloremque sunt atque

Ipsum vitae debitis dolores vel dolore. Quas corporis tenetur facilis quos aut corrupti facere! Officiis doloremque amet nesciunt commodi ab corporis expedita provident assumenda? Consequatur voluptatem ut eius modi facere? Aspernatur asperiores repudiandae labore non odit Debitis tempora perspiciatis quas nisi tenetur corporis quaerat! Aut cumque ullam quis quibusdam harum.
```

Hi @Skylla54, title page styling is somewhat out of the scope of the pandoc theme. You'll need to configure that separately (probably via an additional latex header). Also, if you want to discuss this further, please open a new issue on dracula/pandoc, as that's the place for issues with the pandoc theme, not here!
